speaker: Frasier
text: Before we begin, I'd like to say how honoured I am to be taking over this slot.  Obviously, I have some rather big shoes to fill - my predecessor here was much beloved.  But I have never been one to shrink from a challenge and I'm sure we'll enjoy many happy years here together in my new home.  Now, today on "Medical Minute"...  _The camera pulls back to show that actually Frasier is auditioning for a TV show after he got fired in "Sweet Dreams."_

speaker: Frasier
text: We're going to be tackling the sticky subject of...

speaker: Director
text: Dr. Crane, great audition.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  That's all you need?

speaker: Director
text: I think we have a good idea what you're all about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent.

speaker: Director
text: Er, we'll be in touch.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure you will.

speaker: Director
text: Next, please!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, formalities?  Yes, I understand.  You know, perhaps I'll just take a walk around the station.  Check out the dressing rooms, introduce myself to a few people.  Say, you know, is there a sign-up list for the softball team? I'm sure that Frasier "Slugger" Crane's gonna be an asset to this station in more ways than one!  **DENIAL** _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. It is early in the morning and Frasier is playing the piano as Martin enters in his dressing gown._

speaker: Martin
text: Morning, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good morning, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: A little early for the piano, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm sorry about that.  You know I woke up this morning thinking about that operetta I've been writing.  You know, the one about Robert and Elizabeth Browning.  I think, well, I had to get right to it.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's what you get living in a big city: If it's not the horns waking you up it's someone writing an operetta about the Brownings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I'm pretty sure I've solved the problem.

speaker: Martin
text: Good for you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: But you know, I'd have to hear it to be sure.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll bet that. _Frasier obviously wants him to sing it with him but Martin doesn't want to.  Eventually, he angles around him and they sit at the piano._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh come on, Dad, it'll only take a minute, I just want to do this one section.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, but I'm not doing the accent!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on.  All right, we'll take it right here.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is it that you feel...

speaker: Martin
text: Love?

speaker: Frasier
text: That fear which you conceal...

speaker: Martin
text: Love?

speaker: Frasier
text: That powers that you heal...

speaker: Martin
text: Love?

speaker: Frasier
text: Reveeeall.  Take me in your arms...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll just have to sing it with Niles later.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that'll cheer me up. [_Walks to table and picks up sketches_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, be careful with those sketches.

speaker: Martin
text: Sketches?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, you know I've been telling you that I'm redecorating the apartment, I thought why not just design my own furniture?

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, Frasier, you know you've been taking on a lot of big projects lately.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, any minute now that phone will ring with another job offer, and this blessed little hiatus will be over. I want to have achieved as many of my life's ambitions as possible.  Gee, frankly Dad, you should take up a project or two.

speaker: Martin
text: Me?  What are you talking about?  I'm doing stuff all the time.  Why, just this weekend I taught Eddie a great new trick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, come on, I'll show you. [_Walks over to Eddie by chair. Eddie jumps down, Martin kneels_]

speaker: Martin
text: It starts out that I point a gun at him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I like it so far.

speaker: Martin
text: Then I say "Freeze punk, it's all over."  _Martin waits for Eddie - no response.  Martin looks at Frasier and tries again._

speaker: Martin
text: It's all over! [_no response_] Oh come on Eddie, you're supposed to go like this. [_Martin rolls over on back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Now all we have to do is teach Eddie to say "It's all over." _Daphne enters through the front door, struggling with a large, heavy box._

speaker: Daphne
text: Can someone help me here?

speaker: Martin
text: What is all that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Some books Dr. Crane sent for me to get from storage.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's research I'm doing for a novel I'm planning. Gee Daphne, I was beginning to wonder what was taking you so long.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, excuse me.  But I did have to move 3 crates, a rowing machine and a cast-iron bath tub out of the way first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, look at that.  The only book I really wanted was on the shelf already.  You'll have to take these back down. [_Bell rings from kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, that's my duck!  Thank you, Daphne.  When you're done with that, I need you to run some errands for me.  I need a very sturdy lemon-zester, some more music paper, some potting soil and an easel.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd be happy to.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_muttering_] And then maybe after that I could draw a bath, strip you naked and scrub you with a loofah.  Would that be all right, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't even see you standing there. [_Daphne exits_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_Gets up from chair_] Hey Niles, can I talk to you about something?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, just one second, Dad. _Niles shuts the door, holds onto the handle, waits for a moment and sighs.  Then he turns to face Martin._

speaker: Niles
text: OK.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's about Frasier.  Ever since he got fired, he's been so weird.  All these projects he's got going...

speaker: Niles
text: Yep, don't worry, it's normal.  He's simply in a state of denial. [_Sits on arm of chair and begins to tie shoelace._]

speaker: Martin
text: Denial about what?

speaker: Niles
text: About getting fired.  People like Frasier's whole identities revolve around their job.  The loss of the job is like a... is like a death.  And they cope with it in the same way they would cope with a death, by going through a series of stages. First one's denial; usually that's followed by anger; then, er...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Comes out from kitchen, and calls loudly_] I've done it! Escoffier's most difficult dish done to tangy perfection! You know, sometimes I think I missed my calling by not becoming a gourmet chef. [_Exits back to kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: See we're still in stage one.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_From kitchen_] Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey Frasier, you ready for our squash date? [_Frasier exits kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, I'm so sorry, I'm going to have to cancel - I've been cooking all morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I'm holding a little picnic for the KACL employees and their families.  As you may recall I did get them all fired. [_Frasier laughs_] So I was just hoping to make amends by serving up a little duck a l'orange and an al fresco mea culpa!

speaker: Martin
text: You know, people like chips at a picnic too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Ah, yes, Bebe.  Yes, yes.  Oh yes, the television job. Oh, what a relief.  Thank you, bye-bye. [_Hangs up_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_excited_] You got it?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank goodness.  That job starts tomorrow - I have got things to do.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry?  My God, you sound just like Dad.  I am going to get another job.  The people of this city need me.  I am a beloved Seattle institution.

speaker: Martin
text: [_Sitting at breakfast table_] A couple more days like this and he's going to be _in_ a beloved Seattle institution. **ANGER**  _Scene Three - Seattle Park. Roz, Bulldog and Frasier are in the park talking over a picnic table. People in background walking and talking._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wait till you hear this, I got a job today. [_Roz and Frasier congratulate him_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: You've got to rub me for good luck.

speaker: Roz
text: Where?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, start at my knee and work your way up.

speaker: Roz
text: Where's the job?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh-oh-oh, all right.  It's that new all-sports station.  I got the breakfast slot.  I even came up with a slogan, "Coffee, eggs and Bulldog."

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds like some sort of Malaysian Happy Meal.

speaker: Gil
text: A word of caution on the hummus.  To be avoided - as a leper would avoid a magic tea-cup ride.

speaker: Roz
text: Gil, Frasier made that.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's quite all right.  I understand you need to flex your critical muscles while you're between jobs.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh good, then you might enjoy this one: "After sampling your [_???_], I was tempted to describe your entire Middle Eastern buffet as 'The Sorrow and the Pita.'"  Oh, who's got a pencil, I've got to write that one down!

speaker: Tooty
text: Hi everybody. [_Others greet her_] I just got the most exciting news today: they just picked up my story time theatre on public television. [_Others congratulate_] Talk about living happily ever after, eh?  Chi-ching!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Dr. Crane

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well hi, Kenny

speaker: Kenny
text: Great party.  Oh and by the way, I picked something up for you on my way to work today.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Surprised and jealous_] Work?

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, yeah.  They took me back at my old job.

speaker: Kenny
text: I was passing the bus stop and... Excuse me a sec.

speaker: Kenny
text: Anyway, they were about to paper over your poster, so I peeled it off for you. [_he hands the rolled-up poster to Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that is quite a keepsake. [_Begins to unroll it_].

speaker: Kenny
text: Don't mention it.  Oh, and by the way, the poster under yours was an old radio guy. [_Thinks._] Er, a Dr. Earl.  Who was he again?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Thinks_] You know, I'm sorry, I don't recall.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, I'm the same way.  Once they're off the air, who remembers them? [_Laughs._] _Frasier laughs also, but is struck by the comment.  Kenny sees someone else, and leaves.  Frasier rolls up the poster.  Roz enters from left._

speaker: Roz
text: Do you realize that we're just about the only people here without a job?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: If we don't get this Top 100 spot, there may not be any left.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Comforting_] Roz, I've told you: We have nothing to worry about.  Come on...

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone, if I could have your attention, please?  We have of course planned some activities for today's little get- together, and I'd like to start with one for the children.  _Frasier moves along with group of children to a pi?ata hanging from a tree.  A large group watches from a short distance._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now what we have here is an authentic Mexican pi?ata. [_Hands pole to blindfolded child._] The object is to take the stick, and give it a little whack. [_Gently hits pi?ata._]

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, good for me.  I just got the Top 100 job.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Incredibly annoyed_] Oh well, good for you, Gil. [_Holds stick with child_] Yes, you're going to want to give this little fellow a good crack.  Otherwise...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, maybe I ought to get this started for you. Otherwise the candy will never come out. _He starts hitting the pi?ata very hard.  The group cowers and withdraws._

speaker: Frasier
text: Everybody knows that keeping something locked up inside is never good for anyone, is it?! _He thrashes the pi?ata very hard repeatedly, until the stick breaks. Roz and Bulldog look on.  Then his mobile rings.  He pauses, and takes out the phone from his trouser pocket to answer it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes, Bebe.  We did hear the news, and how thrilling for Gil.  Could you hold, please? _He looks at the phone, then drops it on the ground.  He starts to stab at it with his broken stick.  The phone breaks up into many pieces.  End Of Act One.  Act Two._  **BARGAINING**  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Niles and Martin are in the lift, going up to Frasier's floor. Martin is sorting through mail and singing, and beginning to annoy Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: What is this I feel, love.  That fear that makes me conceal, love.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Was I doing it again?  Damn.  Was I doing it before Mrs. Walsh got off?

speaker: Niles
text: That's why Mrs. Walsh got off. [_Martin acts annoyed._] So, what's Frasier doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, he's getting weirder.  He beat up a pi?ata yesterday.

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't that what you're supposed to do to a pi?ata?

speaker: Martin
text: Not like this.  They found a jawbreaker on the other side of the highway.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thinks, then_] Oh, well, this is good!  It means he's reached the anger stage.  In due course he'll go through bargaining, depression, and finally acceptance.

speaker: Martin
text: What's bargaining?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, it's like when a person makes a deal with God to spare their life.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, I know all about that.

speaker: Martin
text: I remember right after I got shot, I said, "God, if I promise never to drink another bottle of Ballantines, will you let me get through this?"

speaker: Niles
text: You still drink Ballantines.

speaker: Martin
text: Not in bottles, baby. _Martin unlocks the door and enters the apartment, which is filled with all sorts of plants, and serving dishes full of fruit.  A waiter is walking round with a serving tray.  Frasier is stood by the breakfast table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're just in time, I'm throwing a party for my fan club.

speaker: Martin
text: Here?

speaker: Niles
text: Is there some problem with the bridge they normally meet under?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Laughs_] Very amusing, Niles. [_Serious_] You see, I've been doing a lot of soul-searching lately, and last night... I did something which I haven't done since I was a very little boy. I got down on my knees on the bedside, and I prayed for guidance.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I asked God, "What can I do to get my old life back?" And the answer came, "take better care of your fans."

speaker: Martin
text: [_Long pause_] God told you that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I have taken my public for granted.  I take weeks before I answer my fan mail, if I answer it at all.  I've been a bad celebrity.   Well, no more! [_Goes over to pour drink._]

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't even know you had a fan club.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they meet on the internet, and I visited their website yesterday for the first time. [_Brings hand up to head, and shakes it_] Bad celebrity!  But I invited them all here, and you know what?  They were so grateful that before long, I mean, my God, suddenly they were proposing that they hold a massive rally in my honor, demanding that I return to the airwaves.  You know, I think that it's safe to say that someone is already working in mysterious ways. [_Laughs._]

speaker: Martin
text: Someone sure as hell is. [_Walks over to kitchen._]

speaker: Waiter
text: [_To Frasier_] Some crab puffs, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, you just keep them away from me.  It won't be long before I'm back in the public eye, and I've got to remain tight and trim. _Daphne enters, struggling to hold a large cardboard box.  Her hair is ruffled, and she is carrying a torch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne. [_Walks over to collect box._]

speaker: Martin
text: What you got there?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, just a box of Dr. Crane's publicity photos from the storage cubby.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s._] Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: This flashlight sure came in handy.  Helped me to find that box way up at the top of that old bookcase. [_Shuts door._] And when that thing flew in my hair, I had something to beat it to death with.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good Lord, our first arrivals.  God, I've got to check the food.  Daphne, will you run to the store for me?  I need some felt-tip pens to sign these pictures with.  Do you mind? [_Runs into kitchen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Sure, what else have I got to do?  _Daphne answers the door to Aaron, a young teenager, and Doris, a middle-aged woman with glasses._

speaker: Aaron
text: Hi, Daphne. [_Turns to woman, excited,_] It's Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  Have we met?

speaker: Doris
text: We know you from the magazine.

speaker: Aaron
text: April '96, _Seattle Monthly_ , "At home with Dr. Frasier Crane." You were wearing an orange flower dress.  And your hair was different then.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, how creepy.  Do come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come in, come in. [_Shakes Doris's hand,_] I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Doris
text: Wow!  Hi, Doris Butley.

speaker: Frasier
text: Doris... [_Lets go, and shakes Aaron's hand._]

speaker: Aaron
text: Aaron Fitch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Aaron... Oh, it's such a pleasure to meet you.  You know, perhaps I should introduce these people to you. [_Turns to Niles and Martin.  Guests both look surprised._]

speaker: Doris
text: Oh, we know who they are.

speaker: Martin
text: And now, where we live. _CUT TO: Daphne standing by the door.  George is waiting there.  He is old, and shy, and carrying a camera._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh don't be shy, come in, come in. _George runs up to Frasier, and points the camera in his face and takes a picture._

speaker: George
text: This is great, this is great!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm Dr. Frasier Crane, it's a pleasure to meet you.

speaker: George
text: This is great, this is great! _George puts his head next to Frasier's, and takes a picture of the two of them.  Frasier is stunned slightly.  Cut to Aaron talking to Niles._

speaker: Aaron
text: It's cool, isn't it?  Your brother having his own club.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, well, seeing all of you, I sort of wish I had a club myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps you'd like to fill out these name tags while we are waiting for everyone else to come.

speaker: Aaron
text: Who else is coming?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the rest of the fan club. Dorris: This is the fan club - the three of us!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_By door, exiting and laughing,_] Well, I'll be off to get those pens now! [_Exits and closes door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps you should all help yourself to some food. Um, Niles, may I have a word with you, please?  _He walks to the kitchen.  George is staring at Niles, who is unsure what to do.  Frasier calls from kitchen:_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  _Niles slowly edges to kitchen.  Frasier, Niles and three waiters are in the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't let them do this rally.  Three kooks marching round in a circle, you know what that'll do?

speaker: Niles
text: Make them very dizzy very fast.

speaker: Frasier
text: Make me a laughingstock - I'll never work in this town again. I mean, I've got to stop them.

speaker: Waiter
text: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to carve the second turkey.

speaker: Niles
text: No fighting over drumsticks at this party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it! [_Knocks Niles on the arm_

speaker: Frasier
text: How's everyone out here?

speaker: Martin
text: [_Sitting in his chair,_] Oh, great.  We were just talking about the rally.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, Dad?  Oh, I'm glad you brought that up.

speaker: Martin
text: They had it this afternoon.

speaker: Aaron
text: Right in front of city hall.

speaker: Doris
text: It couldn't have gone better.  George even stopped traffic by lying across the road on a psychiatrist's couch.  The cameramen sure loved that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cameramen?

speaker: Doris
text: Oh, what are we doing?  It's almost time for the 6 o'clock news!

speaker: Aaron
text: You're going to love this, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_To waiter standing behind him,_] Excuse me, what have you got there?

speaker: Waiter
text: Er, still the crab puffs.  Shall I get you something else?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Taking whole tray,_] Yes please, bring me some spring rolls.  _Waiter exits.  Frasier starts eating the food off the tray. Niles gives Frasier a look._

speaker: TV
text: Now on the lighter side, did you ever ask yourself, "What if they held a rally and nobody came?

speaker: George
text: This is great, this is great! [_Takes picture of TV_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Forget the spring rolls, bring me the freakin' turkey! **DEPRESSION**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment Frasier is in the kitchen, leaning into the fridge.  He has obviously gained weight._

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Do you think we could talk to you for a second in the living room? _Frasier comes out of the fridge with a plate of food, and is eating it with his hands - not very Frasier!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, sure.  Gee, sounds kind of serious.

speaker: Martin
text: It is, kinda...  _Both exit to the living room, Frasier eating on the way.  Niles and Daphne are sat on the couch, Roz on the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, what is it?  Oh Roz, I didn't hear you come in.

speaker: Martin
text: I think you had the blender going. [_Both walk over to Martin's chair._] Er, Frasier, we're wondering, do you think you might be depressed?

speaker: Frasier
text: Depressed?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, we've all noticed that you've put on weight lately. [_Cuts to Frasier, who has a large tummy,_] we're worried that you might be eating excessively.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Sits down in Martin's chair, continuing to eat._] Well, gee, maybe I've gained a pound or two, but it's nothing I can't handle.

speaker: Niles
text: So you think you've got everything under control.

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Martin
text: It's time, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Remember when I had that babysitter that was stealing from me, so I had to put in that hidden camera?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: And remember when you babysat for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: What about it?

speaker: Roz
text: Just watch this. _CUT TO: shot of the TV, with video playing.  It is in black and white, and of Frasier with baby Alice._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o:_] Well, baby Alice, I think it's meal time.  Let's see what's on tonight's menu. [_Gets up and moves around._] Ah yes, strained beef and lima beans.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh all right, point taken.  So I've put on a pound or two- but the camera adds ten!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Tries to feed baby, but she won't take it._] Come on, yes, now, its very good.  Here, I'll show you. [_Eats spoonful of food._] Um, oh my.  Alright, here, now it's your turn.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on TV_] No, still?  You know, that's not even a proper spoonful.  Let's get you a full one. [_eats that spoonful._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on TV_] That's a nice big one.  You know what, let's try something else.  Oh, some pureed chicken and yams. [_Takes spoonful_] Come on now, open up.  Open up!  Now well, if you're not hungry, you're not hungry. [_eats spoonful._] My, well.  They taste pretty good together.  Let's try that. [_Eats double spoonful._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on TV:_] Tell you what, what's that you have in your baby cup there?  Is that apple juice?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh all right, enough!  Turn it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess maybe you're right, I am depressed.  What of it?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, we're just trying to help you get to, you know, the next stage.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stage of what?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you know, I think you're dealing with the loss of your job as many people do with a death.  Only you've got yourself stalled in depression, and I think you're going to stay there until you let yourself grieve.  For everything you've lost. [_Frasier looks annoyed,_] Your job, your friends, the money, your reputation. [_Frasier seems to grudgingly agree._]

speaker: Roz
text: You've got to let it out, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thank you all very much for your concern, but you know what, if I was repressing anything... _Frasier tries to get up from out of the chair, but needs help from Niles and Martin._

speaker: Frasier
text: I would certainly know it.  The only thing that I need to let out is these so-called one-size-fits-all lounge pants.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that went well.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, we gave it a shot.

speaker: Daphne
text: What do we do now?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we can't push him.  If he's not ready, he's not ready.

speaker: Daphne
text: What was that?

speaker: Roz
text: Was that Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_comes into living room,_] If anyone's hungry, there's a freshly made Monte Cristo in the waffle press.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh great, thanks, Fras.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, are you all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am quite sure.  _Frasier rests against the wall, facing away from others, and pauses. Others look on, concerned._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you're not famous any more.  _Frasier lets out a big cry.  Niles goes up to him and leads him down towards the couch._

speaker: Martin
text: What did you do that for?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, dad, he needed a push.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but look at him, this can't be good.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it is good.  Let it out, Frasier, let it all out.

speaker: Niles
text: That's good, that's good.  Let it all out.

speaker: Niles
text: OK, Frasier, that's probably enough now.

speaker: Martin
text: How much more can be in there?

speaker: Niles
text: OK, all right, Frasier.  That's probably enough now, OK. [_To Martin:_] I don't think I can get him to stop.

speaker: Martin
text: This is sickening.

speaker: Daphne
text: What are we going to do?

speaker: Martin
text: Somebody get that Monte Cristo in here. [_Daphne runs to get it_]

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, it's all in how you look at things.  Look at my life...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Wailing still_] No career, no relationship, no hope.

speaker: Roz
text: You can say the same thing about me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was talking about you! [_Roz hits him gently._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_Bringing over waffle_] Dr. Crane, my Grammy Moon used to say... [_Frasier yells loudly,_]

speaker: Martin
text: What are you trying to do, kill him?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_pointing at Roz_] Don't blame this on me.  She brought the bloody tape over!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, so now this is all my fault.  You saw that tape.

speaker: Daphne
text: I saw your baby, too.  She could stand to miss a meal or two.

speaker: Roz
text: She's a healthy baby!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it, stop it all of you. [_Wailing still_] There is no hope.  It's over.  Over. [_Sobs_]

speaker: Martin
text: Look at that!  I'm so proud of you, boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dad, you're just saying that! **ACCEPTANCE**  _Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Niles is sat at his table when Frasier walks in looking very trim and very smart.  He sits with Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, please join me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you very much. [_to waitress:_] I would love to have...

speaker: Waitress
text: Wait!  Mochaccino, extra whipped cream and a Linseed Torte, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Not anymore!  Can I have a non-fat latte please?

speaker: Waitress
text: Hey, didn't you used...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  I used to be on the radio, with any luck I will be again.  Thank you for remembering, it does help.

speaker: Waitress
text: I was just gonna say, didn't you also used to get a bear claw?

speaker: Frasier
text: Off you go!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I just have to say "Bravo!"  You're slim, well- adjusted, you've really turned things around, haven't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's easy once you hit rock bottom... and bounce! [_laughs_] Thank you, Niles.  I couldn't have done it without you.

speaker: Niles
text: I did nothing you wouldn't have done.  And you'll be happy to know my own life is on quite the upswing as well.  I just got back from a meeting with Maris and her lawyers.

speaker: Frasier
text: And?

speaker: Niles
text: [_grinning_] I think this divorce is going to go very smoothly!  **DENIAL**
